metadata.title: CVE-2022-22823 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
build_model in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has aninteger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-1
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-1
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.22.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-1').
xmlrpc-c package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
libxmltok package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.22.04.1~esm1').
